required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Trial to Evaluate Pharmacokinetics, Pharmacodynamics, Tolerance, Safety and Immunogenicity of Single Injection of Increasing Doses of BCD-131 to Healthy Volunteers Compared to Mircera® and Aranesp®
clinical_study.official_title: Open Clinical Trial to Evaluate Pharmacokinetics, Pharmacodynamics, Tolerance, Safety and Immunogenicity of Single Injection of Increasing Doses of BCD-131 to Healthy Volunteers Compared to Mircera® (F. Hoffman-La Roche Ltd., Switzerland) and Aranesp® (Amgen Europe B.V., Netherlands)

brief_summary.textblock: BCD-131 is pegylated darbepoetin beta. BCD-131-1 is open clinical trial to evaluate pharmacokinetics, pharmacodynamics, tolerance, safety and immunogenicity of single injection of increasing doses of BCD-131 to healthy volunteers compared to Mircera® and Aranesp®. Clinical trial will be conducted in two stages. On first stage the optimal dose for therapeutic use of BCD-131 will be determined (subcutaneous injections). On second stage the determined dose will be injected subcutaneously and intravenously.

primary_outcome.description: Area under curve (AUC) "concentration - time" from 0 hours to 1176 hours and to infinity

secondary_outcome.description: Maximal concentration of drug in blood after single injection
Time from 9 hours to time of maximal concentration of drug in blood after single injection
Half-life of drug in blood after single injection
Elimination rate constant of drug in blood after single injection
Clearance of BCD-131 in blood after single injection
Area under effect curve (AUEC) "absolute reticulocyte count - time" from 0 to 1176 hours post-dose after single injection of study drug
Area under effect curve (AUEC) "hemoglobin - time" from 0 to 1176 hours post-dose after single injection of study drug
Absolute maximum of reticulocyte count (AC-Emax - reticulocytes) after single injection of study drug
Absolute maximum of hemoglobin (AC-Emax - hemoglobin) after single injection of study drug

secondary_outcome.measure: Intensity of pain after subcutaneous injection according to visual analog scale
Frequency of adverse events (AE)/ serious adverse events (SAE)
Frequency of early withdrawal due to AE
Proportion of patients with binding antibodies to BCD-131

arm_group.description: Healthy volunteers will receive BCD-131 in a dose 0.05 mcg/kg subcutaneously
Healthy volunteers will receive BCD-131 in a dose 0.15 mcg/kg subcutaneously
Healthy volunteers will receive BCD-131 in a dose 0.40 mcg/kg subcutaneously
Healthy volunteers will receive BCD-131 in a dose 1.05 mcg/kg subcutaneously
Healthy volunteers will receive BCD-131 in a dose 1.70 mcg/kg subcutaneously
Healthy volunteers will receive BCD-131 in a dose 2.25 mcg/kg subcutaneously
Healthy volunteers will receive BCD-131 in a dose 4.45 mcg/kg subcutaneously
Healthy volunteers will receive Mircera in a dose 1.20 mcg/kg subcutaneously
Healthy volunteers will receive BCD-131 in a dose 0.45 mcg/kg subcutaneously
Healthy volunteers will receive BCD-131 in optimal dose determined on first stage of clinical trial intravenously
Healthy volunteers will receive BCD-131 in optimal dose determined on first stage of clinical trial subcutaneously

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Volunteer are healthy according to screening investigation, including absence of history of hematologic diseases. Results of hematological, biochemical blood analyses are in normal ranges, including serum ferritin, endogenous erythropoietin No history of alcohol or drug abuse.
Exclusion Criteria:
History of using any erythropoiesis stimulating agents. Acute hemorrhage, donation of blood / plasma or blood transfusions during the 2 months prior to study enrollment.
History of chronic hemorrhage. History of allergy to any of the excipients of study drug. Current use of drugs or history of diseases that could influence study drug pharmacokinetics.
Full list of inclusion and exclusion criteria can be found in Protocol of the study.
